clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Quality of Bowel Cleansing in a Real Clinical Practice Setting
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Quality of Bowel Cleansing in a Real Clinical Practice Setting (CALICOL Study)

brief_summary.textblock:
Publications of the use of bowel cleansers in usual clinical practice are lacking. Patient adherence to investigational products increases in the context of clinical trials. By the same token, efficacy of interventions may be overestimated in clinical trials.
For this reason, an observational study to collect data on the effectiveness of several colonic preparations when these are used under usual clinical practice is proposed.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with adequate colon cleansing
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with punctuation in Boston bowel preparation scale (BBPS) ≥ 5

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with adequate colon cleansing of different administration schedules
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with punctuation in BBPS ≥ 5 in each administration schedule

secondary_outcome.measure: Identify factors influencing bowel cleansing quality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship between BBPS ≥ 5 and age, gender, ethnicity, weight, height, tobacco consumption, concomitant diseases, medications and indication for colonoscopy in a multivariate analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of total volume of liquid ingestion in the effectiveness of bowel cleansing agents
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Relationship between BBPS ≥ 5and the volume of liquid ingestion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of each adverse event reported per patient in each administration schedule

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of bowel cleansing comparison among different bowel cleansing agents
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of percentage of patients with BBPS ≥ 5 between different bowel cleansing agents

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of subjects' satisfaction between different bowel cleansing agents with a five point likert scale

intervention.description: Bowel preparation for bowel cleansing in a real clinical practice

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients who have been performed a colonoscopy and who have received a bowel cleansing agent according to the investigator criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-80 years
- Subjects who have been performed a colonoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects being previously performed colon surgery.
- Subjects suffering from active inflammatory bowel disease at the time of performing colonoscopy.
- Subjects with extreme limitations due to disease.
- Subjects in who Boston Bowel Preparation Scale (BBPS) is not available
- Subjects who have undergone a colonoscopy during their participation in another clinical study.
